main event: A bright blue-white ball of light was observed falling straight down.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on January 9, 1958, at 2216 hours., The object was described as being as big as a wire., The observation lasted for a brief period of time with no sound or trail from the object., The weather was overcast with fair visibility during the sighting., Conclusions suggested that the object could have been a balloon or possibly a missile.
sighted object: a bright blue-white ball of light
witness description: The witness provided details about the object's size and motion.
